physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Ictal recording during v-EEG showed right focal to bilateral clonic seizures with hemifacial clonic movements spreading to the superior and inferior right limbs, ending with an opisthotonic posture. Interictal v-EEG revealed normal background activity with rare spike and wave discharges in the left frontocentral brain regions. Ophthalmological examination showed no abnormalities.

vital_signs.ECG: prolonged QT interval secondary to hypocalcemia

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Routine blood tests revealed hypocalcemia, hypomagnesemia, and hyperphosphatemia. Liver and kidney function tests were normal, with hypercalciuria and hypophosphaturia present.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Serum magnesium, phosphate, alkaline phosphatase, and calcium levels normalized during hospitalization.
